content:
One way to identify which component is not properly registered on the system is to look at the error message more closely. In this case, the error message specifically states that the class "epub2pdf.exe" is not registered. This tells you that the component in question is likely a file with the name "epub2pdf.exe".

Another way to identify the unregistered component is to use tools such as Dependency Walker or Process Monitor to see what dependencies the application has and which ones are not being met. These tools can help you identify which DLLs or other files the application is trying to load, and which ones are missing or not registered.

Additionally, you can also check the event viewer for application logs to find more information about the error which might give more details about which component is not properly registered.

Once you have identified the unregistered component, you can then try to register it using the "regsvr32" command or contact the application vendor for assistance.
